intro: Hieracium rigidellum, commonly known as the stiff hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. Hieracium rigidellum is often found in temperate regions and can sometimes be invasive in certain areas.
